column1: The Search Committee finally decided, after a lot of deliberation, on Robert California for the manager position. Who took one look around and left.Â  He drove down to Florida and convinced Joe to make him CEO... CEO... her own job. He talked her out of her own job. And I dont really know how someone does that. But, anyway, then the position was his to fill.Â Â  And he chose
Oh, yeah. Pregnant.
No, I told you I dont like that joke. It is a boy. We found out early.
No one should be planking at all.
You watching that commercial again?  Why do you keep watching it, if you know its just gonna make you cry?
Hes got a bank vault. Thats a start.

The new CEO works out of the conference room about half the time. But whenever he takes a break, he does these weird walks around the office. And you never know who hes gonna zero in on for these really intense small-talks. You just hope its not you. And yet, you hope it is you too. Its strange.
Can I call you right back? Thank you very much.  Okay.  What is this?
Its, its nothing.
Â  Its just a list of our names, split into two columns.
Okay, just wait one second, alright? I will copy it. Do you have a pen?
No. Okay. Um, Ill take a photo of it. Dwight, can you throw me my phone?
We dont need a warning signal, Kevin. We can see him right there-
I promise you, we dont need a warning-
Left.
Why are you- How do you know?
Uh, no, actually. That was in Roberts notebook.
Okay, its not that Pam. You know, I was thinking it reminds me of those lists Dwight used to make.
I dont think its-
Thats not it.
Mmum, still wrong.
Wait, wait, wait! Stop! Stop! Stop! Will you stop?!
Alright, well, I will see you in a bit.
Hey. Its nothing. Alright? Ill text you when we get there. Let you know whats going on.
Nope. No dog video.
Okay. See you guys.
Uhhh, the street?
Oh, I didnt know anybody called it- She likes it a lot- she, uh, loves Elmo.
Right.
Yeah, she does like Elmo.
Well, that was certainly an odd lunch. Is everything alright?
Shhh.
Alright, Im gonna go warm up the car.
Ryan? A little help?
Uh, I will have the chicken piccata with a side salad.
Good. What? Nothin
I dont think we have to do this again cause its gonna take a whole.
Come on, man.
Hey, so this isnt matching up with thisand Im not sure which ones right. Can you just hunt down the original for me?
Alright.
Hey Kev, what were you saying before about the paperwork?
Yeah, alright Kev why dont you come with us?
Does it save time though? â€˜Cause weve been here for about an hour.
K, Kevin, are you saying â€œSee the worldâ€? or â€œSea World?â€
No, see? Right there, thats the problem with your method. â€˜Cause I still dont know if youre saying â€œSea Worldâ€ or â€œsee the world,â€ and its taking a lot of time to explain it.
How many L to a K?
Ill take five.
Your ex-wife?
Wow. Alright. Cant wait to meet her.
She looks at it when shes on the potty, and she makes the faces.
We know that.
You have a walking buddy.
I can have it to you by the beginning of next week.  Alright? Thanks very much.  Uh, Phyllis! Bracken Auto?
Ok.
Andrew.
No, I didnt notice anything.
I dont know what to tell you, man.
Oh, one hundred percent.  We all want to see you tattoo your ass.
Nah, you definitely werent kidding.  And that came across loud and clear. Oh, by the way, I want to hand this in.

Yeah. Big sale. Dont worry about it though, I dont really care about the points.  I would like a point receipt though Hey! Yes, this is Jim Halpert calling for Donaldcan you hold on for one second? Thank you very much.
and Im back. How are you sir?....I think we can squeeze a couple more golf games in, right?
Gettin psyched up?
Andy, nobody really expects you to go through with this
I mean, do you like it? You having fun?  Tell you this, everybody else is having a lot of fun.and you did that.
But I think its big enough to buy you some time till your next great idea.which, by the way, I cant wait for.
Absolutely not.
Pull up your pants.
Id hang on to it though, cause I can think of a bunch. Like a 70s theme party, or a 70s theme meeting, or a 70s theme convention...
Nope, he means tuna dog.
Do Snowboarders hate animals?
Dwight! At least aim it.
Whoa whoa whoa whoa!
Alright! Nice job, Oscar!
So...ah, whos gonna take the dog?
What if he jumps out the window and runs away?
Oscar, what do you wanna do, this is kinda your deal. You wanna dog?
Yeah, thats pretty good.
Nice job.
Oh man, its gotta be over a hundred thousand dollars.
I mean, I dont even know what Id do with all that money.
No, Id probably buy a big piece of land in Maine, build a house, work in town. Somewhere I could bike to or kayak to. Id either bike to my job at the kayak shop or kayak to my job at the bike shop.
Whoa. Saucy. I thought you liked Maine?
Which ideally would be me....
Stop. Im a barista in your fantasy?
I dont know about Stephen King, I mean...
Uh, yeah. I mean, as the strongest person in this office, I guess I should go down with you...
OK. Three hundred boxes of twenty pound white. Thats seventy-five boxes per person, so thats not so bad.
Nice.  Whoa whoa whoa whoa! Oh!
Theres gotta be a better way to do this. This is literally how they built the pyramids.
Yeah  Not that theyre not smart people.
Id go with that.
Not that, dont...
Its a great idea Kev, I dont think it applies here though, so maybe we just-
Our fake winnings
It is, yeah. I mean I just dont know why Im compromising if its my fantasy. Cause in my fantasy its Maine and you love it.
Nope. Youre, youre doing a great job of it in my fantasy right now.
A...hot chocolate tea
Kevin Costner.
Yeah.
So, its not the dumbest idea.
But, the fact remains we gotta move these boxes.
So sadly, its the best idea on the table.
Is he OK?
OK, alright, thats...look. All we were trying to do is we thought we could come up with a more efficient way to do things.
Thats alright.
Doesnt matter what the name is. SeÃ±or Loadenstein, thats stupid.
Thats OK, were good.
Porque es muy rapido.
Right. Its city and country combined.
And I can fish right from the window of Pams pottery studio. And we can chat any time we want.
Just like now....too bad the schools are terrible.
But what are you gonna do about that?
Ok, ok. We are so close. All we have to do is figure out that corner and were basically there.
Ok, Dwight! Come on. Here, I think I have an idea.
Dammit Dwight!
Ok, I have a question. Why is the truck so far away?
Ok, I just asked that ques-, I dont know. I mean it seems like the door is huge, right? So you should be able to back the truck up to the paper.
So this warehouse has been around for what? Like a thousand years? And they never thought to back the truck up into it? I guess sometimes it just takes a fresh set of eyes. Alright!
Whoa whoa whoa!
No! Stop! Stop stop stop stop! Youre way over! Ok, you gotta cut it! Cut it hard! (bleep!) Stop stop stop stop! Stop, stop! Dammit Dwight. Great.
Good.
Hey. So, we saw a new billboard.
Youve seen it, right?

Theres this thing that people tend to do with billboards. How do I put this? If theres an opportunity for a graffiti artist to work in a... phallic shape, interacting with the artwork, itll happen, and Andy gave them that opportunity.
Okay, dont be gross.
Ah, and did Robert California get an invite to your party?
So, weve typed in the address, now lets take a look at the street view.
Ah. Why do you keep reading that garden party book? I mean, how hard are finger sandwiches and tea?
Im actually really disappointed in how poorly my book is doing.  Ive only sold one copy.
Chapter 2 â€“ Announcing guests as they enter is the height of decorum. The more volume displayed, the more honor is bestowed upon everyone present.
Oh, hey, how are you doing, Im Jim.
No.
No, no, no, no, no. No.
Chapter 4 â€“ One of the hosts most important duties is as Dance Master. A proper courtly dance sets the tone for the entire afternoon.
Chapter 9 â€“ The tableau vivant is not only welcomed, but expected entertainment at any garden party.
Closing ceremonies.
I think I left my wallet in your house.
Right here.
Keys, keys...
I didnt forget them, theyre right here.
Im so sorry, I think I forgot that thing...
Whoo.
Hey, I have a question. Who do you think is really the best salesman in this office?
Chapter seven The host should always present something spectacular to draw the eye of his guests.
I dont know if I can.
Alright.
I know, I know, I know. But Darryl and Kevin needed a third. They bought me this jersey. I said no. Kevin started crying. So, I am Chris Bosh.
No! My wife does not believe in ghosts.
Hey.
Oh, this Man In Black thing, what do you think that was about?
Was it, like, trickery in the lights, or maybe you were so primed to see it, then there it was?
Mmhmm. No, but what Im saying is, like, do you ever wonder what it was?
Yeah, I had just told you about the day that I met the Blue Angels. I figured you had to top it.
Hey its Jim Halpert.  I was wondering if you wanted to see a movie tonight.  Because Ive read a lot about this really great documentary.
Its called Ghostbusters.
It didnt have a buster sign around him?  Why dont you draw him?  Why dont we see this whole thing.
I aint fraid of no ghost.  Whoa!
You know thats
I was talking about my wife and how she believes in ghosts. And then we had a little debate and Meredith said she believes in them too.
Party looks fun doesnt it?  Everybody seems to be in there having a great time.  So maybe now would be a great time for me to pop back on the computer.
Are you serious?
Thats funny.  Ok.
Thank you.
Careful, whoa. First of all, its not like I think thats going to help the Eagles win.
No. That is just a bunch of people participating in a collective thing that maybe the Eagles will hear about and want to play better. Its not...
Thank you.
Like, a few years down the road, Cece says, "Mom, theres a ghost in my closet." Now, you say one of two things - one, "Youre just having a bad dream," or two, "Lets go see what it was."
Ok.
Oh, come on!
Pink is the red-
I was talking about my wife, and how she believes in ghosts. And then we had a little debate. Meredith said she believes in them too.
Oscar, how are you on that side?
But that would make more sense.
...W R K.
Uh no its W R K, as in kitten.  Oh my boss is singing Closing Time, maybe thats what you are hearing.
Im just saying with the NBA lockout I think roller derbys in a really good place now. Somy pitch isme, Pam, you and, someone else maybe Justine.
Is that off again?
Ok.
Wait, so you installed a doomsday device?
Which when it goes off it destroys everything. Very similar to a doomsday device.
Dwight, question.
If this doomsday device goes off...
If this bad idea goes off and we all lose our jobs. Are you going to feel good about that?
Ok.
Nope.
HmmHeda.  No.
Ok, where is he?
Ill try both.
Robert.
Yeah, well, you know just had a meeting. Squash meeting.
You up for a game?
Exactly. Here we go. Lets do it.
Alright. Serving. Serving. Serving. Serving.
In the box.
Is that my phone?
Nah, I think its mine. Lemme just check real quick, here. Alright.
Oh, oh yeah.
Yes. Right now? Yes.
Here you go.
Awww, sorry. Did it break?
You sure?
What kinda iPhone is that?
Oh yeah. I have the one that nobody has. Is there anything interesting?
Ha ha. No, I dont. No, I dont. Alright, well, I am sore and obviously horrible at this, so-
Ah! Classic, right?
Im alright.
Yep.
Yep. Ah. Oh.
Yeah. That does not feel good.
Ok, he didnt fix it. The brightness level was all the way down.
I wasnt here that day.
No- Ok. Well, well talk about it later. Straussburg! I had a meeting in Straussburg and I dropped you off beforehand. I was wearing a tan shirt with stripes?
Ok, this is crazy.

I have never played squash. But I have seen it in countless 80s movies and it seems like the most common mistake is that you serve too hard and hit yourself right in the squash balls. So, as long as I dont do that, I think Ill be alright.
Good game. You are a worthy opponent. You wanna play one more?
No? Come on.
Well, that is... because you didnt realize that... I was left-handed.
Hmm. Doubt it.
Whats that?
Honestly I have no idea. I just figured wed save her from Ryan right?
Hey.
Yeah. Super pretty.
The temp?
Nope.
And Im telling you, I dont.
No, I dont.

No, Im not going to tell my nine-months-pregnant wife that I find her replacement objectively attractive. Just like Im not going to tell my two-year-old daughter that violent video games are objectively more fun. Its true, but it doesnt help anybody.
Okay. Uh, I dont. So are we good?
Oh, I stand corrected.
Oh, you know who might be good? Mike Tibbets.
Mm-hmm.
Not his moms car.
Touche?
Mike Tibbets is like the most boring-looking guy I know. So if that was for the matchmaker test, I think Im in the clear. If that wasnt for the matchmaker test, then... Cathy, hes a really nice guy.
Dwight!
Dwight! Dwight!
Sorry about that.
Dwight!  Why?
Leave.
Mm-hmm?
Told you.
You okay?
Okay, what can I do to make you believe me?
Stop shoving me.
Really?
Si.
Okay, Dwight, come on.  You can go first.
Oh, you know what? This reminds me, Cece needs a new toothbrush.

No, Im not worried. Because this lie isnt for me, its for Pam. And when she gets her body back and her confidence back... yes, I will tell her the truth. That I had feelings for a co-worker today that I havent had in years. But in my defense, he was grabbing my crotch fairly aggressively at the time.
No.
I am not lying.
Pam, are you really gonna listen to his stupid homemade test?
Yeah, but I dont smoke.
I dont know.
Okay, easy. Trust me, Im around for the long-haul.
Okay.
Thank you.
Oh okay, shes going into labor. Make way, everybody!
Okay.
Oh my God!
Okay guys, here we go! Well see you!
How do you feel?
Cool. Thanks.
Visitor center. Gonna grab a map for the memorials, right?
No, of course were not tourists. Were just people that arent from here who are taking a tour.
By the way, did we leave all the food on the bus?
Yeah, thats what I had for breakfast and I think thats probably why Im still hungry.
Only two hundred dollars?
Oh wow.  So thats two miles if you incorporate the walk back.
Yeah sorry everyone else didnt come.  I think theyre just tired.  With holes in their shoes.  And they have dysentery.
What are you talking about?

Andy â€“ this whole idea of our situation being just like war?  Its just not true.  We just work at a paper company.  And youre our regional manager.  And guess what man?  You dont have to prove anything.  We like you as regional manager.  Andy if you dont believe me take a look at whats on my head.  Im wearing a very pink hat.  Ive been getting weird looks all day because Im pretty sure â€œDM does GBâ€ means something kinda sexual.  But guess whos wearing them?  All of us.  Just for you man.  Thats huge.
Theyre terrible.
Tuna?
And to drink?
Oh-ho, I am in.

Im excited, Ive actually never been to Gettysburg. Uh, my family was gonna go once, but then my brothers convinced me if was full of dead soldier zombies, so I freaked out and we turned the car around. But Im older now, I can outrun a zombie.
Where do all the cool kids go when they come to this consecrated ground?
Its locked.
Thats weird, if its not locked, why isnt it opening?
Ok, you know what? Andy probably has the number for this guy. Im gonna find him.
We didnt have one scheduled.
Hey guys lets just all admit it. Ok? Dwights better than us. He had the guts to stop sitting. And hes never, ever going to go back on it right?
What are you up to? Oops look out!
Prank!
You know what its not my best. Because you could just easily bend over and pick it up right?
Because youre sitting?
Ok.
Because youre sitting?
You know I have to do this.
I think you could just do Andy Bernard.
I dont know. He wasnt talking to me. But if I were you I wouldnt hire his wife.
Well its sales. So you have to be able to live in the world of rejection.
Well its not that easy. Its kind of sometimes difficult.
No, I dont think we should be trying to make this place seem unpleasant. I think we should let this place just crush her spirit by itself. I mean, it knows what its doing.
Oh, wow. So cute.
Very cute.
Oh wait, wait, wait! Hold on, hold on. I just need to get through. Just real quick. Real quick, open... uh, okay.
Oh. Ow. Ow. Ow.  Creed. I was never here, all right?
Oh boy.
Do I?
I know, I do.
I really wish I could help. Im not really sure how I can...
Thats the thing. See, I didnt want to get in the middle of this. Still dont. But heres something I feel that maybe, if we take a step back, this is a simple case of anxiety to work with a spouse.
Perfect!
Yes?

I dont know what you want me to tell you. To be really honest, my wife works here. And I love it. She literally makes me work harder. She makes me smarter. She makes me remember why Im here. And between us, shes on maternity leave right now, and I would love to leave this room and see her face. I would love it. I dont know how this helps, but its just what Im thinking.
Yes. All right. Great.
This whole thing is making me very uncomfortable. Im not getting between the boss and his wife so just ask me about something else. You know Stanleys tie is really the story of the day...

Ok, so thats a disaster. Luckily have a two-part plan. One, run. Two, hide. Its pretty smart, right?  Hi, how you doing? Im Jim Halpert from across the hall. We are redoing our supply closet and I was wondering if I could take a look at yours for some ideas.
You absolutely should. He said it was ok, so till you get him, Ill just be in, you know.
I got Stanley tickets to see Lewis Black for his birthday. ...Might not have been the best idea.
Shes not your grandmother, is she?
Yeah.
It wasnt me.
Kathy wants to leave our clump?
Ow, What are you doing?
Pam never seemed to have a problem with us.
What was that?
Cant do that.
Ah... Im gonna s-
Dwight really wants my bonus. Hes trying to entrap me. Oh god, now I cant drink at this thing....I get really pranky when I drink.

Uh, yeah. I just got my replacement credit card...you want the number? Oh its uh four seven nine three, zero zero three two, three three one three. The security code is nine two seven. OK great. Thank you very much. Bye.
So Dwight did take the bait. He used my credit card numbers to send a two hundred dollar bouquet of flowers, to my wife...from me.
I wonder, in this office, who has access to a porcupine?
Hmm...
Nice try, this is ridiculous.
Three times.
Andy, youve gotta be kidding me.
OK, you know what? Why dont we just call animal control...
Yes, Im calling from Dunder Mifflin. We have a very rabid porcupine in our office, someone should come pick it up.
Uh, I dont know, let me ask.  Uh, were you quilled?
And whats its name?
Oops.
Hey guys, sorry to interrupt, I uh, just found this on my desk.  Need to talk to somebody about it. Can you believe that?
Yes. It is.
I know, I mean the way I see it is you can deface any picture of me, any one, pick one. Not my kid though.
I dont-
Yeah.

Let me just see that one more time. Yep, you know what? I know who my friends are, now. But I shouldnt have got you involved because the truth is, I dont even really care about this picture, its a little out of focus. It was probably an accident, right? Like...
Right. Youre right. So maybe it was me who did it...by accident.
Ill figure it out, get to the bottom of it....Merry merry.
You alright, Santa?
Yes.
Two friends who are not sleeping together, can they remain friends? Yes, yeah.
OK.
Alright. I will definitely do that.
You know what? Youre sitting, and thinking, and its probably better if it comes from me anyway.
Yes. They totally do.
Oh man, I was supposed to tell Dwight something......Cmon, Jim.  I got nothin.
Cathy wants to leave our clump?
Sorry it didnt work out. Hope you find what youre looking for.
Thats ok.
Thatd be great, thank you.
You can write a book about chairs.
Very nice. Very nice sales pitch for our clients that dont know what paper is.
Stop right there. I love it.
In Philadelphia.
Thats a great idea.
Yeah.
All right, good stuff.
I thought it was a fun idea.
Okay.
Theres a table over here.
Shawn Marion.
Wrong, for so many reasons.
Oh my God. Lamar Odom, yes.
All right.
Andy, its the last day of the quarter. Weve already called all our clients, so making that much in a day is going to be tough.
Andy, were gonna do our best. But you know what? At the end of the day seven point...whatever percent is pretty good.

Its always more fun to mess with Dwight with an audience. That was usually Pam so now that shes out I had to find someone else. Turns out that Stanley is quite the comedy fan. But not everything makes him laugh. He has very specific tastes. Through a painstaking process of trial and error, Ive found out what he likes. And its really weird.
I know.
Whoa, looks pretty nice. Got a little bit of a Shining vibe, though.
You know, theres a glare from over here... oh wow, thats magnificent.
Im sorry, I thought you were making a joke.
I guess I thought you were approaching it with more of a sarcasm than misery. Kind of laughing at your own pain, sad clown thing.
Hey. Wow. Just stopping by. Got another party to go to. A wife and two kids at home party.
DJ Pam Halpert is spinning some serious Radio Disney tonight.

Youre looking at the master of leaving parties early. They key is, you have to make a strong impression, so you want to have a picture taken, you want to say some peculiar non sequitur that people remember, you want to note something unique, a talking point, for later. I dont mean to brag, but New Years Eve, I was home by nine.
Robert, just wanted to grab you one second. This place is amazing, by the way.
I bet I should.  Thats beautiful, Im going to email that to you.
All right-
I must...
Robert, thank you. Thank you for this. Thank you for all this. This nights been magical.
Really? Why?
Good night.
To both these bears.
To madness.
Hey, um, I think you parked my car in. Is there any way you can move your van?
Are you serious?
And theres my talking point.
To the shame room!
Hey.
Okay.
Yeah.
It was pretty uneventful, actually.
Uh, hit and run.
Nope. Not guilty.
Were best friends, actually. Were going wine-tasting next weekend, if you want to come.
Okay.

I did get called in to jury duty. And they released me around noon, so, didnt think it was worth it to come back to work for a half day. And then the next morning Pam was a little overwhelmed with the kids so I took an extra day to help out. And then three other days happened.
Aw man, I would but I cant miss any more work.
Mine was actually a pretty boring case, so-
Wow, Im really sorry.
I never considered that my week off would make everyone elses job harder. The least I could do is give them a good story.
So Phyllis, he was here, and then the car came and did- he was like that. Yeah, so it had to be a double backflip, actually.
Oh man, Ernestos. That was our favorite restaurant too.
Mm-hmm.
Mm-hmm.
Okay, wait, wait.
No. I never said he was on a bicycle. I just said I wasnt listening to you.
...and Pam was just going crazy, trying to take care of Philip because Cece has been out of control recently, and- look, Andy, it doesnt matter. The truth is, I just feel terrible lying to you.
Okay. I think the best thing to do right now is just come clean and tell everybody the truth.
No.
No.
Are you sure you can keep this under wraps?
Uh-
The empanada guy!
Uh, you guys are going to love these. So, empanadas on me. You guys gotta try them.
Because my car broke down.
Well, I think you handled it pretty well.
Okay, listen, all right? Dwights on to us, hes going to figure it out really soon, so lets just get ahead of it, lets tell the truth.

Uh, excuse me, can I have everyones attention for a second? First off, I just want to say that Im really sorry, I didnt know that my absence last week would have been a burden on any of you, because, though I did have jury duty last week, they did dismiss me early on Monday. And I think youre going to find this pretty hilarious. I kind of, uh, well, maybe took the week off.
Funny? No? Nobody laughing?
Pam really needed some help with the kids, so, I promise my intentions were good.
You want a giraffe?
Yes, I am brining my kids in to help me get out of this hole. And you all remember my beautiful wife, Pam.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, game face, baby, game face.
Whoa, no, no. Thats overdoing it, I think.
Split the difference?
Okay, lets go.
What?
Wow, what a surprise. Thats crazy. You guys get to meet the little heck-raisers.
Did you say something about this one bringing in something for these people?
That was a great idea.
Oh my goodness, lets take a look at these. Theyre usually amazing, so lets see. Yup, they are. Uncle Andy.
Oh, Aunt Phyllis.
You know what? I dont think you need to do things on command. Thats very weird. Ill just take that. Thank you. I think we should just wrap up the show, kiddos. Right?
I dont know what else we can do here.
Its okay.
All right, all right. Okay.
All right, I know, I know. Lets just get this.
I know, buddy, I know. Cece, you want to come? Want to come out?
Oh bud, I know. Do you have a pacifier or anything?
Cece!
Okay, okay, we gotta go. All right, were going home, were going home. Were going home, were going home. I know, I know, bud.
I know, I know.
Im gonna grab her, okay.
Hi, all right. Im just going to go down to the car and Im going to put her in her seat and Ill be right back up.
No, no, its okay, Ill be right back.
Thanks guys. All right, here we go. Lets go.
I would love for everyone to just forgive me. But, if thats not happening, Im not averse to just buying them all off.
Alright guys. You know how we all like the red licorice but its always buried behind like a ton of black licorice?  Bought it all. Now its like red city in there. So, enjoy it.
Uh, I cant get a handle on it. Am I cheap or rich? I cant...
Alright. Well, enjoy the red licorice, and good riddance, right?
Its not really food, right?
Ok, ok, ok.
â€œAnd shove it up my butt.â€
Im not gonna eat it.
Im not-
They hate me, Pam.
No, its bad. Darryl canceled go-karting....
Its a lunch thing.
I feel like a stranger in my own country.
Ok. Well, hey, youre not here. You dont know, Ok? Its intense. They made me eat black licorice.
Oh ho! Look whos back reporting for duty.
Nope. Its over.
Nope. OK.
Ooh, me three.
I just got a text from Robert California that says â€œbring your clubs to Floridaâ€.
I hope not.  Because I am not going. Two question marks?
â€œRobert, Hey!â€ Exclamation point.
â€œGot your text, awesome idea. Lets hit the links next time youre in PAâ€ Dash JH.
Yeah, its a golf text.
Duh- Wait. I just feel weird. I should just call him.
Robert, great offer. Wish I could hit the links with you in Florida but a father of a newborn really should be helping out his wife any chance he gets.
Ok, sending.
Really did  He responded L-O-L.
Now, is it too dark to say that Cicis having an operation?
I think youre right.
Total nightmare.
Yeah, thats what Im saying. Theyre incredibly helpful, youre lucky to have them. I mean with them there, you probably wont even know Im gone.
You know Dwight, if you didnt want me to go the smart move would be to tell Andy that I actually am essential to the operation. That way I couldnt go.
Hold on, just wanna get it on camera.
